review:
95％引きの100円なら圧倒的お勧めです。 当時の紙資料のスキャン物もつくよ。
パッドのキーコン設定するまでの間、左スティック触るだけで再起動する状態で笑った。

共通
パンチ、*ヴァルケン式*シールド、ダッシュが操作上の追加要素で、ゲーム性を大きく変える。
パンチとダッシュの挙動にはシリーズ他作にない味やゲーム性があり、独自の面白さを見出すことができる。
キーコンが古臭いので、盾とパンチをショットと食い合わない位置に設定するだけでぐっと遊びやすくなります。
追加された盾はヴァルケン仕様で、時間的な制限のないシチュエーションだとかなりのテンポキルと引き換えに退屈で安定した攻略が可能になる。 ボスも同様。

アレンジ版
*無難にバランスを取られた代わりに劣化したレイノス2* 味が強い。 オートエイムはない。
敵の動きも変わり、(オートエイムなしで)高速宇宙戦闘をさせられ、"スズメバチ" も出る等、2にかなり寄せている。
敵破壊時の爆発にダメージがないのでパンチしやすい。
多くのステージはスピードが求められるため、シールド安定とはいかない局面も多い。

クラッシックモード
追加された仕様と相性が悪く、逆につまらない。盾ゲー。
時間制限はないけど敵が際限なく出てくるから際限なくしばいてもいいけど虚無。
なぜクラッシックモードにもヴァルケン式シールドやダッシュが追加されているのかは謎です。

review:
今風アレンジの良さもあれば酷評部分も分かる、惜しい部分がいっぱい。そんな出来。

基本的に、UIとかオプション周りはほぼほぼガンハウンドEX感ある。BGM/ボイスのバランスが気になる。何度も調整した。ボイスは特にばらつきがある。BGMアレンジ的に音色がふわっとしてるのでかき消されがち。ステージの途中で水しぶき、ミサイル噴射の煙等のスプライト部分にバグが出て緑色の■がしょっちゅう出てしまう。どことなくデバッグ不足感を感じる。

リアタイでレイノス１、ヴァルケン/ガンハザード、レイノス2、ｳﾞｧﾉﾚｹｿ、ｶﾞﾝｳﾞｧﾙｹﾝ、ガンハウンドEXとやってきて、メーカーや開発スタッフ等はそこそこ把握した上で遊んでますが、レイノスとは？ヴァルケンとは？そのあたりのアイデンティティみたいなものを改めて考えてしまう。かといってレイノスをそのままの原作システムのままでやるとアレはアレで楽しいが厳しいと感じる人もいたり。じゃあ名作ヴァルケン～レイノス２で完成された多ボタン操作の快適な操作やシステムでアレンジするとどうなるか？しかしそれはもはやヴァルケンかレイノス２であってレイノス１じゃないのでは？みたいな気持ちにもなる。まあそこらへんはリメイクアレンジいろいろなので、楽しければいいかなとは思う。クラシックモードやるなら最初からシールド無しでやると雰囲気出ますが、原作はあそこまで１面シビアでもない気が。

個人的に思うのは、物語終盤に近いほど、ステージ構成や設置されてる兵器等がほぼほぼヴァルケンから持ってきたもので「え、これ公式的に許可とれてるの？」みたいな同人的なノリもあってファン的にはニヤって思えるか半々なところもある。そこらへんはまだいいけど、個人的に、うーんって感じたのは、終盤になるほど弾幕化・誘導化の敵弾ですかね。レイノスはガードさえして逃げてればHP自動回復するシステムなので被弾せず逃げたらいいけどそれでヒットアンドアウェイするしかなくなるにしては、相当バランス悪くなってる終盤。加えて、無制限に撃てる武器が限られてるので、最終ステージいきなり使い切ると、実質１つの武器でしか戦えないという。そこらへんヴァルケン寄せにしてるのであれば、リロード可能にしたほうがゲーム的には面白かったのでは。レイノス１なのかヴァルケンなのか、レイノス２なのかガンハウンドEXなのか、複合的な作品になっているので「オレがレイノス１を現代リメイクしたらヴァルケンｘレイノス２風にしたのがコレ」みたいなアレンジ。しかし、出来で言ってしまうと、おそらくｶﾞﾝｳﾞｧﾙｹﾝとかの方が上のクオリティかもしれない。なんだろう。どこか体力が尽きたか何か分からないが、道半ばで見切り発車したような半端さも感じる。

でも正直、そこまで酷評して叩くほど悪いわけでもないので、モヤモヤはするけど悪くないとは思う。プレイして得られるEXオプション的なシステム周りでいじれば、ほぼほぼヴァルケン寄せにもできるしBGMもMD版で遊べたり、そこらへんは遊ぶ側の工夫でより楽しくなるとは思う。ちなみにPS4版だったかディスク製品版は出荷本数が少ないせいかプレミア化してるようなので単純にゲームだけ遊びたいならセールで買って、他者のレビューはそれはそれとして楽しむと良いかと思います。数少ない２Dロボアクションゲーなので、こういうのはもっと残っていいと思う。もうちょいグラはLive2D的なやつではなく、ドットで描き込みました！みたいな雰囲気が欲しいのと音源・音色に関しても内蔵音源系も選べたらより楽しいかなと。この手のゲームの魂を引き継いでくれるメーカーがあれば、次が見たいですね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198816104211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 404, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1711812865}
review:
「ヴァルケン」を踏まえた新しい解釈のレイノスとしてみた場合、ゲームとしてはほぼ満点近い出来です。（というより原作のレイノスがゲームとしては大雑把すぎた面もある）
ヴァルケン譲りの優れた操作性に加えて、装備選択の戦略性もしっかり生きており、
難易度に関してもハードにおいては原作さながらの歯ごたえそのままに、原作からはくらべものにならないほどステージ構成や敵配置がしっかり練られており、しっかりと動かす楽しさ、上達の実感、戦略を練る面白さを体感できます。

が

ファンサービスであろうヴァルケンオマージュの演出やボスの量が過剰で蛇足な面があったり
スコアがたまるごとに設定モードで隠し設定が解放されるのですが、その中に「最初から選ばせろ」と言いたくなるような基本的なものまでちらほらあったり
明確にゲームとしてダメな点として、一部のボス搭乗時等に、自機が操作可能かつ無敵もとくに付与されないままカメラが遠くのボスの位置に合わさる演出のせいでこちらの立ち回りが難しくなったり（酷いときは演出後指定の場所へ瞬間移動させられる）
そしてこのゲームはある展開によってエンディングまでの展開が若干変わるのですが、エンディング時のエピローグテキストが、どちらの展開とも矛盾するものとなっていたり

細部において詰めが甘いのも事実です

総合的に見た私の感想としては、レイノスのリメイクとしてはほぼほぼ問題ない出来ではあったので、ヴァルケンやレイノスが好きな方は購入する価値は十二分にあると思います！（原作に近いシナリオとステージ構成になるモードもありますしね）

XBOX360　以外のコントローラーはまともに動作しない様子です。
しかも箱コンでも起動の度にパッドを設定し直すという作業を挟まなければなりません。

review:
This game is a rusty old mobile suit you found in an abandoned hanger. If you're technical enough, or just obsessed enough, you can jump through all of the hoops needed to get it running. If you're the right kind of person, this game will be special enough to warrant that effort.

Leynos is a short, but technical game that lets you fly around like a maniac putting your robotic fist through the windshields of enemy pilots, and has some of the best zero-gravity combat in any game ever. Want to jet backwards in space at mach 20 while strafe-shooting at a giant battleship? This is your game. Features like the gun direction lock and jet boosters give you a high level of control over your machine.

Most people, who don't want to fight with keyboard/controller support, should seek out the much more polished Assault Suits Valken and play that instead.

review:
Мне не зашло.
Начну пожалуй с чувства ностальгии. Оригинальная игра мне сильно запала в душу, в ней было идеально все. Игровой процесс, музыка, геймдизайн, сюжет(хотя сюжет я понял чуть позже, на эмуляторе пере проходя игру), уровень сложности.
Почему мне не понравился ремейк(ремастер) называйте как хотите, так вот, игра меня с заставки уже оттолкнула Рок ремиксом и стилистикой заставки, казалось бы, ну и ладно, главное ведь не она, подумал я, и думал что в гемплее мне будет по приятнее, это оказалось ошибкой. Все ремиксы в игре в рок версии, почему? Я не хейтер Рока, Рок это круто, но здесь? В оригинале музыка была более космической, а здесь что? Рок и драйв, в не совсем драйвовом дизайне?

Дизайн.
Что с ним не так? Ну не знаю, игра выглядит дешевле Sega версии, задней фон будто комиксная статичная заставка, в такой-то игре? А что по кораблям и мехам? Это чересчур кислотные PNG картинки, на общем фоне ярко выделяються, но не вписываються с общим фоном.

Сложность. 
Не понимаю, или на движке стоят ограничения, или почему в игре так мало врагов и объектов на общем плане? На Sega зарубы и масштабнее выглядят, и нет чувства одиночества, и пропорции у кораблей и их дизайн лучше. Пол игры, меня не переставало покидать мысль одиночества, и я один, и врагов так мало. И тут ясно, почему в боях даже на фон не кинули союзные корабли и мехи, врагов то тут не так много, как на Sega было. Да они бесполезные, но они хотя бы чувство одиночества не оставляют, союзники там и тут тока в кат сценах, а да, еще в начале были боты, которых надо было сопроводить, отличная идея, тока вот почему опять один, почему разнообразие врагов уменьшено?

Механика. 
Если в Sege было допустима, механика и управление мехом, то на новом движке и с увеличением сложности и боссов можно было что-то сделать? Хитбоксы некоторых боссов и меха ужасные, в тандеме с управлением катастрофа. Я больше 20 раз подыхал, именно из-за управления, да есть щит всемогущий, но он не спасает тебя от всего.
Финальные боссы настолько крутые по хитбоксам и механике, что случайно могут тебя шотить, при удачном место расположении, и это независимо на каком уровне ты играешь,[spoiler] вот Ланс, прыгает резаком на тебя, чутка задевая тебя, должен нанести урон, но он может случайно шотнуть тебя, не зависимо, сложный уровень или легкий, фулл хп у тебя или нет. В битве с синими пушками, круто придумали, в мыслях разработчика, пушки можно атаковать тогда, когда они находятся на переднем плане, ну по началу не понятно, да и когда изучив все равно не понятно, когда они там находятся на заднем или переднем фоне, особенно когда они вращаются вокруг тебя колесом. После смерти на этом этапе, еще и пушки багаються, они могут возникнуть как в первый раз, по одной, а могут сползти от места твоей смерти в точку где должны заспавнится, и все это время они с самого начала могут тебя шотнуть, эти пушки вообще могут заспавнится все и сразу, на рестарте уровня.[/spoiler] Весело что сказать. Очень весело.)

Из плюсов, аватарки и диалоги выглядят по лучше, пару новых сцен и персонажей, спасибо, но удовольствия от этих фич не перекрывают тот факт, что ты не можешь отдельно управлять пушкой и движением героя, как и зависнуть на месте в игре довольно сложно. А зависнуть в игре придется.
Есть классик мод, в нем есть и музыка, и масштабы, и союзники, но почему это было не совместить с доработанным сюжетом? Не понятно.

P.s Не жалею что купил игру, т.к. приобрести оригинал в Steam нет возможности, я готов закрыть глаза на все то, что я не получил удовольствие играя в игру, тока за счет призмы ностальгии, пройдя старую игру, в душе станет еще чуточку теплее. Не рекомендую покупать для ознакомления, лучше пере пройдите на эмуляторе старую версию игры. И нервов потратите меньше, и наслодитесь и гемплеем, и музыкой.
(По налил воды, водоналиватель =D)

review:
[h1]A hidden jewel of its time[/h1]

I'm old enough to remember seeing Assault Suit Leynos for old Sega Genesis back in the day. Unfortunately, Leynos somehow lacked the stronger PR of other space opera game of its time like Gaiares or Thunderforce so it escaped my radar.

Now that I play the remake, I seriously regret having missed it.

Playability-wise a lot of people won't like it... and they're right, the point of power armor is for it to move natural and be an extension of your body, but I'm of those that like their videogame mecha to feel clunky, to get the feeling I'm really lumbering around in 2000 tons of steel (like Final Zone or PS1's RX 78 Mobile Suit Gundam). 

The new graphics and music are beautiful and I enjoy them a lot.

The best part, though, is the story. Cheese as the dialog may be, Leynos was seemingly [b]decades[/b] ahead of its time in terms of videogame narrative, where most schmups still were on the candid, quaint premise of "you're a lone ship that will bring an armada down," Leynos was re-enacting Gundam, from depicting the war campaign, to plot twists and humanizing (and dehumanizing) both warring sides.

The only downside is the lack of "new game plus" (unlocked weapons don't stay that way on future playthroughs) and the fact that you need to get every single objective in each level or you won't have the weapons you need to go through the last level's boss gauntlet, but I can forgive that.

Play it. That's all I can say.

The graphics and sounds ARE better than the sega genesis (but cheap looking), there is a level select, there are a few bonus content type things, and voice acting, but that's about it. Menus are buggy as hell, it HATES full screen, and the menus are weird before you set it to controller. 

The game makes me think of something on newgrounds or some browser based flash or java type game, nothing wrong with that out right but...for 20 bucks I would expect something with more polish than a game that could have been made in flash. 

And I am not entirely speaking of art style, there are just...things I would not expect to BE, like falling into a death pit you can still move your mech about...and in some cases jump out of the death pit while the game is saying GAME OVER...but you are still there...

Or having the camera purposefully not allow you to SEE said death pit until it is too late and you are falling into the death pit. Or damage that just shreds through you with no remorse and if you didnt have an armor upgrade on to act as an extra life, it's just game over right there.

The game has so many bullet hell type enemies thrown at you, and you NEED to be able to move about with speed and have defense, it says "you can equip up to 6 weapons!", all weapons (aside from the machine gun) have limited ammo, meaning you -NEED- the machine gun, you NEED the jet pack for avoidance , and you NEED the shield just to survive the bullet hell. . . so that is 3 right there out of your 6. Now you need to equip armor to act as extra lives. 

I played the original Target Earth, I know it was hard. But these changes seem....weird... Spoiler alert, there is a mission where a pilot cant get back to the ship in time for atmospheric entry , he burns up and dies. In the sega genesis version if you had the shield, you could use it to keep yourself and him alive outside of the ship. In this? you automatically die as you just..burn up where you are. They dont even have a transition of the background layer, you just start burning up despite being in space and not seemingly moving. 

Which is another odd thing... Half the game feels like the images for ships are too large and ratio gets thrown out of whack, a battle ship shooting a satellite in space on the sega genesis? well the battleship is now so big, takes up so much screen space, that it looks like it just drives over the satellite instead.  The ratios of things all over seem just...odd, especially at  over 4 gig for this , the game should NOT be that big. I've seen better looking, better handling, and all around better games with more content, use up half this space. 

The game DOES have extras! like a laser sight for your gun so you know where it is pointing! or a gauge for your jet pack! . . . that are unlockables. . . because. . . i dunno, they had to put what should be basic settings for UI upgrades behind . . . an unlockable segment.

Also, if you DO get this, you can navigate the menus via arrow keys, and i think Z is the button to ACTUALLY select options, enter? space bar? nope and nope, those don't even register. Controller? nothing works except I think the right shoulder button on an Xbox controller, and the thumb stick will just RESET THE GAME...why..who made this?! You have to go in and tell the game to use "Standard X box Controls" because it defaults to some WEIRD thing, instead of making the standard 360 controller...be the standard.

For every thing I like about this, that the game did RIGHT, it seems to get 3 or 4 other things wrong, and that's a damned shame.  Buy it if you REALLY want an upgraded Target Earth, but this kind of left me wanting to play the original more than i wanted to keep playing this one.

review:
TL;DR - A buggy mess with bad design.  I recommend [i]Gigantic Army[/i] instead.

Right off the bat, input does not work correctly.  The game launches and starts an intro/attract mode and you cannot get out of it.  Enter, spacebar, gamepad buttons, nothing.  Pressing escape instantly quits the game.  You have to press 'z' to go to the menu and then turn gamepad on.  In game, double tapping the shoot button reloads your gun and this is not configurable.  So when you shoot an enemy, stop, then shoot another enemy, you will often trigger a reload which will prevent you from shooting for a few seconds.  Update: Leaving the window in the background for a while while I type this review has caused gamepad input to completely stop working.

The game runs in a 720p window by default.  You can stretch this window arbitrarily and screw up the aspect ratio or go exclusive fullscreen at 1280x720 which will screw up your desktop.  There is no borderless fullscreen support despite the game supporting arbitrary stretching.  There is no fullscreen resolution setting.  If you maximize the window, the game will be slightly distorted (with crusty scaling) due to window title at the top.  If you go to exclusive fullscreen, the game will exit fullscreen upon completing a level (at least the tutorial level) and takes several seconds to reinitialize.

The first tutorial is standard jump and shoot targets, it's fine.  The second tutorial is an excruciating auto-scroller where you have to shoot bullet sponge drones while jumping over pits that you can't even see because the camera is zoomed in so far that you can't see the ground.  The third tutorial is flying around in zero g.  Again, the camera is zoomed in so far that you can't see where you're going.  The game recognizes this and tries to fix it by giving you an arrow indicator to the next target, but it's just an ineffective band-aid on top of a bad design.  It wouldn't be half as infuriating if the game had precise pixel art, but it doesn't.  It's all puppet animation and rotations and the game even has arbitrary camera zooms - they could fix this level with one number and they decided not to.  Combine the bad viewport with the fact that you can't shoot the targets when they get too close (there is a melee but it is delayed) and the 'double tap to reload' '''feature''' and you've got one annoying ass level.  The tutorial lady expects you to beat this in 40 seconds, it's probably possible but it completely unreasonable and unfun.

Jumping into the main game, I was promptly annihilated on the first screen by mass waves of enemies all jumbled on top of each other spamming bullet hell projectiles and tanking huge amounts of shots.  This was on normal difficulty.  I tried just jetting over them and booking it to the right, but the map just stops, it's an arena style stage that requires you to defeat all enemies.  The only viable method I found was a cheese strat where you hold a hill and spam shots as the enemies slowly climb it.  The second level is more enemy spam - a conga line of mechs will form and they'll all be shooting so it's just a continuous stream of bullets with nowhere to go.  The best strategy seemed to be jet above them and bunch them all together, the tank a few hits as you jump in and punch them all at the same time.  I quit at this point.

The controls are clunky and methodical.  There's a delay in jumping as your jets activate, you slowly aim up and down, that kind of thing.  This is somewhat to be expected for a mech game.  The problem is you're facing a bullet hell crowd of enemies.  You need to be able to jump over shots and instantly shoot down at enemies because there's no other way to handle the situation you're in.  If you put up your shield you're not making any space because there's a continuous stream of bullets, enemies will continue marching forward while you're blocking and then do contact damage.  You can have different weapons but switching between them is slow and has to be done in advance, and you can really only do that if you don't know whats coming next.  During a battle, switching weapons will almost certainly get you killed - it's best to just pick a standard gun and stick with it.  The baffling design is that you have 3 weapons that you can cycle between.  So you've got buttons for next weapon, previous weapon, and shoot.  Three buttons and three weapons.  There's no reason each weapon couldn't be immediately accessible just by pressing one of the three buttons.  Then you could actually use the weapons contextually like it was an actual video game.

Upon restarting the game to make sure I wasn't missing some magical 'unfuck the game' setting, I discovered that the first mission was completely different.  There were far fewer enemies and there was an additional foreground graphical layer in the beginning.  So it's possible that the game isn't maniacally designed, it's just buggy as hell.  Either way it's not worth dealing with it.  I paid $1 for this game in a bundle, so I'm done.  I got more enjoyment out of ranting in this review.

If you think you want to play this game you should play [i]Gigantic Army[/i] instead.  It's old but the controls work and it's a fun and good looking mech game.  Hell, you could even play [i]Steel Strider[/i] or [i]Armed Seven[/i], which are a big step down from [i]Gigantic Army[/i] and you'd do much better than this.

review:
I really don't like twin stick shooters. This game is not a twin stick shooter. I wish this game was a twin stick shooter.

My main motivation for playing this was to understand the story before playing its SNES sequel (Cybernator) so I set it to easy difficulty and started shooting away. The difficulty is weird as hell, the first missions being a walk in the park and the 8th being pretty hard and going on forever (turns out it was not that hard, you just gotta use the good red weapons you get through the game).

Now, the problem is the game decided to turn into a bullet hell shooter after what I thought was the last boss. With its awful controls you'll be pulling your hair out. Now, you do have unlimited continues and reasonable checkpoints (one before a minute long convo-cutscene yay...) but if you spent your special ammo you will be screwed and will have to play hard mode with your standard issue pea-shooter.

The story is ok-ish, the music is I-don't-even-remember-it and the graphics are just dated.

An ok game with awful controls, meaning it's a bad game. Don't buy it. If you want to experience the story just see a playthru on YT as I should have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124014248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1612396661}
review:
I was going to give Assault Suit Leynos a negative review because of how buggy my first playthrough was, but thankfully I decided to give it another chance. Making video games is hard and I'll try to think of this title in the future to avoid being excessively harsh when writing these reviews that nobody reads.
Assault Suit Leynos is a sidescroller, your AS can walk on land and fly in the vacuum of space, both methods of movement take a bit to get used to, but that's normal considering you are piloting a heavy tank on legs. There's an extensive selection of weapons to choose from, although the best ones are reserved as a reward for those who can beat levels with an S rank or accomplish side objectives.
The aesthetics and plot of the game are generally nice, but the music is the real star. There are only a few tracks, but they are all winners.
Overall, the game is very solid, despite being a bit buggy, so I would recommend as long as it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043341011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1596224819}
review:
How on earth can you ruin a SHMUP this badly? Before I begin, I have to adress the elephant in the room, the controls, particularly the lack of the right analog stick's use. You have to aim and move with the left analog stick which is a nightmare.

The game itself starts off fine and all until you get to the first boss... suddenly a time limit appears, it took me a while to figure out that there even was a time limit because the UI isn't very clear to the player. Basically you have to kill this boss before they reach the base, if they do it's game over. This marked the start of things to come.

Stage 3 has a mission that is basically impossible to do without a guide because the game doesn't give you any idea as to what the hell you're supposed to do, you have a time limit and are told "GO!", no objective, just go and do something. The game never tells you that you have to destroy the battle cruiser which by the way doesn't have a health bar.

This is another issue, why do some enemies have health bars and others don't? It makes no sense to me. Sometimes you can barely tell what you are meant to be hitting until you actually hit it. Some bosses have multiple parts you have to destroy to actually beat it, it's a nightmare.

The worst part about this game is the bosses themselves, they just feel to bland and lazy but at the same time tedious and annoying to fight. There's very little variation in theiir attack patterne, many bosses end up just doing 1 attack for ages that never ends and you just have to do that same thing over and over again to win and it gets tedious. 

For example, one boss has an attack that shoots projectiles in a line and it rotates, that's all there is to it, just dash around the enemy, turn around and shoot, rinse and repeat, it's so boring.

There was one boss that started off well having a few different attacks but after you beat the boss you get the most annoying boss in the whole game, I'm talking about the end boss of Stage 6 where it shoots projectiles at you in multiple directions that keep moving back and forth, there is no safe spot and you can move on foot so you have to levitate and time your levitations perfectly to avoid it, sounds simple huh? But wait... you actually have to kill the boss... to do so you have to aim diagonally upwards... the problem is you are constantly moving up and down to avoid the projectiles so you can never get a good aim.

I find that the bosses in this game are just cheap and mostly can be killed just by being lucky. The D D weapon in this game is ridiculously overpowred and deals a crap ton of damage, save that thing for boss fights because it destroys them fast, however it is useless against fast moving targets since it takes a while to actually hit, the clusters it creates are very effective though. Usually I would win just because I spammed the crap out of the D D and won just because it dealt so much damage, that's how I beat Stage 6's boss, I had some D D ammo left and I just managed to get a lucky shot that killed him.

I can't stress it enough how frustrating this game is to play, however there are some positive things I do want to note. First of all, the game is only 8 stages long which is the only reason why I even managed to beat it. Thank god it was short because if I had to play any more of this game, I would lose my freaking mind. Every stage made me want the game to be over... then I realized there was another one and I was like "No, please, not another level!"

The games checkpoints are good for the most part but in some boss fights like the stage 6 boss, there's no checkpoint between the first form and second form and this is a pain because the second form is insanely cheap whereas the first form is a joke when you have the D D and know the patterns.

The dialogue before the last boss is unskippable and the last boss is also very annoying because it has an attack that shoots out in every direction, you need to stay in the middle which is hard because your mech floats about all over the place and is hard to keep stable, if one of those projectiles hits you, it is instant death because they will knock you back and you will not be able to reach the middle again so you just stagger and die.

This game was a nightmare I wish I never went through. Why on earth would anyone want to play this game? I heard the Mega Drive Version was even worse... jesus. Who greenlighted this game!?

author: {'steamid': '76561198004583189', 'num_games_owned': 3096, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1586807533}
review:
重裝機兵 LEYNOS是當初SEGA MD的重製版，畫面和劇情以及一些內容比當初在MD好很多，但以現在的角度來看是很不及格的，當時在MD版我沒有破關過，這次終於破關並且把全成就都拿到了。

如果把這款遊戲當成懷舊遊戲來看是不錯的，但是遊戲內容中BUG很多，比如你無法攻擊畫面外的敵人，但敵人可以攻擊你，在一些宇宙關卡中，敵人有時候會一直卡在邊界外導致無法過關等。

整個遊戲關卡分為經典模式和大型電玩模式，關卡基本上一樣但敵人不一樣，難度差距很大，經典模式有兩個BOSS死法結局，而且又多一個最終BOSS關，整個流程玩下來順利的話約一個小時內可破關，但大型電玩模式就真的會虐的不要不要的。

遊戲操控很吃技術，沒有所謂的自動瞄準等一些輔助，再加上特殊武器有彈藥限制，整個關卡沒有辦法補充彈藥，身上只能攜帶六個裝備，然後裝備的獲得在於每個關卡的結算成績來決定，如果想要取的更多的分數基本上成就那邊就有提示了，當然最基本的小怪都要全清。

另外裝備的總數量不要被上面的總格子數給騙了，上面兩排是滿的，第三排只到B-PACK那邊，所以總計是18種。

[h1]====成就====[/h1]

就講一些比較難拿的成就

Heavy Armor Master：不包含這個成就其他34個全拿到。

Tricks clear of original ：第一關就只殺王拿到分數2800，其他都不能殺，而且過關獎勵很豐富。

Hard Brawler ：只使用拳頭攻擊不使用其他武器，可在第二關來解，前面一開始有一艘突襲艦幫打，第二隻BOSS就跳到BOSS後面先打掉尾部，看好BOSS的腳往前移動就往前打幾下，等到BOSS進入基地他會把自己的砲管給打壞，這時在跳到前面狂打就可以了。

Versis no damage ：在第三關需要裝備三個ARMOR，可進入大氣層時不會扣血，時間倒數的時候不要進入船艦，在船邊等待Versis的機體來，靠近他可幫他回血到地上還活著就可以了。

Explorer：第四關基地內有一個通道下面有三個雷鎖無法下去，左邊的牆壁有管子，打那面牆壁打到有分數跳出後就可從那邊進去到下面。

Knowing rust ：第四關完全不要碰到水，注意的是地上區有三處有水，有一處不注意看就中獎了，BOSS房最下面也是水，跳進去就失敗了。

Thank you , Zozary ：需要在第三關有救下Versis ，最終關BOSS會出來幫忙打，有救和沒救在第八關的BOSS的死法會不一樣。

All weapons acquisition：拿到全武器過關，基本上早期很難，只能去農分數然後開啟獎勵選項，獲得額外的殺敵分數和過關分數，其他的就只能靠技術去農了。


[h1]====結語====[/h1]

不是懷舊的玩家真的很不建議購買遊玩，風格操作等現在的習慣完全不能比，當然如果是買組合包入庫的可以玩看看，不然在STEAM上購買價位真的太高了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052462154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1586434854}
review:
Der Vorgänger von Cybernator

Wie hab ich damals auf den SNES Cybernator gesuchtet. Es hat so viel spass gemacht. Wie sehr hab ich mich gefreut, dass der erste Teil komplett noch mal neu aufgelegt wird. 

Hat sich das gelohnt? Kurz gesagt Definitiv!

Ich kann jeden Action Plattformer Liebhaber der was für Mechs übrig hat, dieses Spiel wärmsten empehlen. Es ist kein einfaches Spiel, bietet aber viel Spielraum für Fehler. Es kam gut vor, das ich schon in der ersten Sekunde eines Boss kampfes Geschichte war, aber wer einen kühlen Kopf behält und die Mechanik mit Schild versteht, wird es wesentlich einfacher haben. 

Das Spiel besitzt 8 Missionen, die Abwechslungsreich gestaltet sind. Wer Cybernator kennt, wird sich hier wohl fühlen, man fliegt durch Minenfelder, im Weltraum auf den Boden, Durch Fabriken auf unterschiedliche Planeten , auf Raumstationen. die Vielzahl der spielbaren Maps ist kreativ gefächert. 

Die Grafik ist liebevoll gestaltet und das Effekt Gewitter einschlagenden Projektile / Explosionen oder halt Laserstrahlen ist Allgegenwärtig. Es ist Krieg, ohne zu Spoilern war ich schon ein wenig überrascht, gegen was für ein Gegner man kämpft. Dieser Krieg wird visuell als auch durch eine hervorragende Sound Kulisse untermalt. Wer Gundam, Macross oder andere Anime Mech Serien kennt, wird sofort sich mit dem Effekten heimisch fühlen. Egal ob es die Geräusche des Suit ist oder das vulcan Gewehr ist, das seine Projektile abfeuert. Wiederum ist die Musik an sich mir zu generisch und Einfältig, schade, aber so hebt sich das ganze ein wenig wieder auf. 

Technisch gab es schon ein paar Aussetzer. Ich hatte grafische Aussetzer gehabt, als das die Suit zum Beispiel bei mir ins Wasser gesprungen ist, kam grüne Klötzchen zum Vorschein. Ich hatte leider auch den einen oder anderen Crash. Auch Ärgerlich war es für mich, das ich definitiv zuerst den Controller an haben musste, wenn ich das Spiel startet. Es ist auch schon vor gekommen, das mitten in der Mission die Suit sich nicht steuern ließe. Wiederum konnte ich aber trotzdem noch mit dem Start in die Option gehen. Alles keine Wesentliche Probleme, aber für den reinen Spielfluss sehr ärgerlich. Besonders, wenn es im Wechsel der Karte passiert und man nur mit einen Neustarten der ganzen Map dagegen entwirken kann. 

Rätseln gibt es keine, die einzige Schwierigkeit ist das Spiel an sich, oder die ganzen versteckten Waffen freischalten zu lassen, wo ich bis heute nicht ganz verstanden habe, wie das so vor sich geht. Als ich dachte, ich hätte es raus, wurde ich es eines besseren belehrt. 

Ich war der Meinung ein Rang S reicht in einer Mission um neue Waffen frei zu schalten. Aber dem war nicht so, als ich eine Mission mit Rang S abgeschlossen habe. Wahrscheinlich muss man das Spiel mehrmals durch spielen und man erhält nur eine Mögliche Chance einer geheimen Waffe zu bekommen, wenn man den Rang S erreicht. 

Ansonsten kann ich nur sagen, wer die Chance hat dieses Spiel für einen kleinen Obolus zu erhalten, der wird nicht enttäuscht werden. 

Grafik : 3
Sound: 2
Technik: 4
Gameplay: 2

Gesamt: 3

Persöniches Fazit: 

Grundsätzlich ist eine 3 jetzt meiner Meinung nach nicht schlechtes. Und das Spiel würde sogar noch besser bei mir abschneiden hätte ich nicht diese ganzen kleinen ärgerliches technische Probleme mit dem Spiel gehabt. Trotzdem Jeder der Cybernator was abgewinnen konnte, wird eine Mords Gaudi mit dem Spiel haben. Kurzweilig, aber wer definitiv alle Waffen freischalten will, mit Sicherheit ein längeres Vergnügen haben. 

Ich werde auf Jeden Fall noch mal das Spiel auf einen härteren Schwierigkeit Grad spielen. Und auch noch mal den Classic Mode ausprobieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250544676', 'num_games_owned': 3672, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1582239764}
review:
Ah...this negative review makes me a little bit sad. I have fond memories of this game from back when I owned a megadrive, and the thought of a tasty modern upgrade was quite appealing. It perhaps isn't a game packed with sexy setpieces (I can't recall) but it was quite punchy in the action.

When it was recently bundled it seemed like a surefire recipe for happiness........and then I played it. 

Civilisation didn't collapse, my dog wasn't run over in the street, nor did I, or a dearly loved family member of friend, get diagnosed with a hideous illness, but something broke inside me nonetheless. 

Seeing a game that looks so gorgeous, that runs so smoothly, handles so well, and gets me feeling all nostalgic, and yet....it plays like total arsebiscuits.

The original was made before analogue sticks were a thing, so 8 way control for your aiming is not an option because the pad it was made for never had any sticks to begin with. Games like Smash Tv solved this by having the face buttons be directions for aiming and multiple held buttons do the diagonals, but since ASL uses those buttons for other things it's not a solution here.

Instead: up and down on the left stick elevate or lower your weapon. This is not just awkward - it's totally crap, and ruins what seems like it will be an excellent update. The original might have played like that, and have been acceptable, but in this day and age (even in 2015 when this was released) you'd expect full analogue control for your aiming to be handled by one of the sticks.

It kind of is...on the left stick. Yup - the one you're most likely moving with.....who the heck designs a game like that when it has controller support? The right stick does nothing, the left stick handles all movement and aiming. And to top that off: no analogue aiming. Even if you play with a mouse!  

After half an hour of fiddling around with the steam controller preferences I did get it so that aiming was on the right stick, but it was still the basic up / down, and nowhere near as intuitive as just pushing in a direction to aim. 

Everything else feels just right: your robot is chunky and hefty, but responsive too. It's a pity they didn't overhaul the shooting mechanics, as it's quite challenging on hard and is crying out for a control scheme that will make it the super badass game it should be.
 
If you want a side scrolling shooter, that has great gameplay and handles on a controller as you'd expect, then 'Intrusion 2' or 'Blazing Chrome' are awesome if you haven't played them. Sadly ASL is too much effort fighting the controls to enjoy it, so I can't recommend it when there are so many examples in this genre that get the controls spot on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302554187', 'num_games_owned': 3354, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1582110511}
review:
コントローラーのキーのYes/Noが設定したダッシュ/ジャンプボタンに割り振られる為、折角の自由なレイアウトも混乱を招くだけ。
そもそもレイノスと云うよりヴァルケン風にリメイクしてあるし、演出が入っても敵の動きは止まらず、戻ったら敵が後ろから攻撃してたり色々酷い。
その為か演出カットモードはあるが、だったら入れた意味が不明。
画面もデフォはヴァルケンみたいな比率で見づらいが、どうもそこの設定はスコアを上げないと出来ないっぽい。
曲のアレンジは良い所も悪いところもあるが、ゲームなのにループを考えてないのを垂れ流しのもあって印象は良くない。
それでもゲームとして面白ければ…ちょっとしたユーザビリティの配慮出来ないデベロッパにそんなもん期待してはダメ。
つまらんクソとまでは言わないが、オリジナルに思い入れがある人程、存在自体を無かった事にした方がいいかも知れない。
自分的には細かい色々が気になって無理だった。
オリジナルを知らない方が楽しく遊べたかも知れないな。
イージーだと体力の自動回復があるみたいなんで、誰でもクリア可能にはなっていると思われる。

author: {'steamid': '76561197997177363', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1581857546}
review:
Neat old mech game. Somewhere between a side-scrolling shooter and an early mech sim. If you ever messed around with Cybernator, Metal Warriors, or Front Mission: Gun Hazard then you might be familiar with the gameplay but otherwise it's a little clunky feeling compared to modern shooters but once you get a feel for it it's really fun and you feel like an ace.

Does come with a few caveats though.

The port is rather busted and kinda undercooked with a few weird graphical glitches here and there and the pad controls just don't work on start up but you can fix that if you just go into the options with your keyboard and set your pad controls to default or customize them to your liking. Some players report getting a ton of slowdown and having the game crash when they go fullscreen and you can only exit out of the game by going into Windowed mode and closing the window. It also might seem kind of pricey for 20 bucks but I got this on impulse when I had a bit of extra money and enjoyed the experience. 

If you have a PS4 it might be better to get it there to avoid all the possible issues but I'm pretty happy with this. Oh, and if you're having a hard time, don't be afraid to quit your game and go into the options since the more you play the more options you unlock that might make things go a bit easier like score multipliers and laser sights. Classic Mode is balls hard too if you want to give yourself a *real* challenge.

review:
オリジナルのレイノスはそれこそ猿のようにやり込みました。(一番難しいレベルでも軽くクリアできるレベルまで。)
自分はレイノスはそれほど難しいゲームだとは思っていませんでした。ダメージ食らっても画面の端の方でゆっくり回復してからジリジリ進み、ボスキャラはせこい裏技で難なく撃破。(故にランスなんぞとはほとんど戦ったことはありません)

それと比べると本作はかなり難しいと思います。反射神経の明らかに鈍った今ではイージーモードでも、コンティニューしまくって何とかクリアできた次第。

いくつか言いたいことはあります。
ちょっとかっこいいシーンで音と画面の同期が取れていないところなどはその最たるもの。
「そこのアサルトどけーーー」どかーーーーーん。というシーン、戦闘機が突っ込んだ後に音声と字幕が出てくるところとか、間抜けすぎて笑いがこみ上げてきてしまいます。セリフを吐いた後も口をパクパクする主人公などは酸欠金魚のようです。
キャラデザもカッコ悪すぎ。もう少しなんとかして欲しかったです。(リーナ曹長が全然可愛くないのは致命的)

それ以外にも、ヴァルケンの様な重量感が中途半端に出ているところとかもちょっとイヤかも。

なんだかケチばかりつけているようですが、ゲーム自体はオススメしたいです。
実際自分はかなり楽しめました。

ただオリジナルのレイノスを楽しんだ人でないとちょっと厳しいかもしれない、とは思いますです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197986677145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1549256798}
review:
Assault Suits Leynos is a remake of the 1990 Sega Genesis game "Target Earth" or "Assault Suits Leynos" in Japan.  Almost 30 years later and partly produced by the original developer Assault Suits Leynos is back with a fresh take on the original game.  Upon looking through a handful of Steam reviews I decided to write my own since a lot of the bad reviews for this game focused on the port being "trash" mostly due to problems stemming from controls when the game first launched.

	The developer did eventually offer a fix and you basically have to set your control to xbox which will allow you to remap a controller.  There currently still is not a method to remap controls for keyboard which is a nearly impossible sell for the large amount of PC players who consider the Keyboard and Mouse to be the ultimate controller.  Not the most intuitive way to fix issues with controls.  I was able to plug in a ps4 controller and use it without any issues.  If you are a keyboard player I would tell you to use a program called JoytoKey to set the controls how you like them, but again this is not an intuitive fix either, and in the future I hope developers allow the freedom to remap controls.  In 2019 not having remarkable controls is considered a solid deal breaker to many, myself included. 
 
	If you did leave this game a bad review due to the bad controls I strongly recommend you give this game another shot if the controls are working for you (the game has been patched a few times even early 2019) and to re write your review to give this game a fair and open-minded chance.  I think it fills a very unique niche that not a lot of developers are daring to fill.  Good games for mech fans especially in this genre are very hard to find.  I think this game has a lot to offer.  Once the controls are out of the way that is.  

	If you've played the sequel to "Target Earth", released on the SNES called "Cybernator", (Assault Suits Valken in Japan) you're going to be right at home here and you even might notice a few really cool easter eggs referring to the game.  The colony break-in and the battery fight boss in the 3rd stage made me giddy when I realized the reference.  You'll also notice that the Leynos has more options than just shooting and jumping.  In the remake you have a shield, dashing & boosting, and the ability to punch just like in Cybernator.  You're going to need all these tricks to get through the game and I have to say the game play with boosting and dashing can be incredibly satisfying especially in space.  

	The game is split into two modes: 
	Arcade Mode is a retelling of the original game but with new bosses, a few new scenarios, branching story line paths, and an extra level.  When you play you get score which will rank you up and unlock small features which add little quirks to the game like giving the commander sunglasses, or adding a boost gauge.  This mode is a little longer than Classic due to the extra scenarios and level.  

	Classic Mode is a bit more faithful to the original game for Genesis, is a little harder, and has that KICKASS soundtrack from genesis.  Fans from the original are going to notice a few small differences like weapons working differently, and a new last boss.  I think the changes were to add more difficulty to the game but honestly it is impossible to say.  I do wish they could have kept the classic mode 100% faithful to the original but it is still decently close.  I would say 90%.

	My biggest complaint with this game is it is a bit short.  There are only 8-9 stages and I had played through 3 story scenarios in about six hours and I was absolutely taking my time.  You can unlock weapons for practice mode but not for classic and arcade which is a huge shame because that would have added a ton of replay value.

	 A problem that I wish didn't make it from the original is the way that weapons are rewarded after missions.  The lowest grade will reward you one weapon and for getting an S grade you are rewarded 3 weapons but the weapons are rewarded randomly and the rate for certain weapons is very low in comparison to others.  This means that you could end up getting the same couple weapons on different playthroughs.  Thankfully the "unlock all weapons" cheat from the Genesis game still works but honestly destroying only the battle ship seems way harder in this game than the original so good luck.  For me classic mode is my preferred way to play because having all the weapons makes each playthrough unique since I get to experiment with the weapons more freely.  

	I know coop was also discussed for this game at one point and silently cancelled but I think it would have added a lot of lasting value to this game, and I personally would have loved the experience.  

		The voice acting is all in Japanese which gives this game a nice anime feel but dialogue can be switched on and off (YES!).  The sound effects are awesome and really make you feel like you're controlling a mech.  The music is good, the original Genesis soundtrack is here and the remake did a good job at bringing the compositions to the modern age but like the original this game just doesn't have a lot of different tracks and some stages share the same musical themes.  On one hand I'm glad they stayed this faithful but on another hand I would have appreciated more music.  

	All in all I would say this game is definitely worth your time and $20 bucks.  I mean I spend around the same amount of money to see a movie in theaters and the experience lately has a been a lot of worse.  The ranking system might give you a reason to keep playing but I think I'll be popping this one in from time to just experience a quality, mech, run n' gun, side scrolling game that has become hard to come by. 

Besides, it is your PATRIOTIC DUTY to train yourselves in mechanized combat for the future sovereignty of Earth!  The world needs you.  Suit up!

review:
I really like AS Leynos, but can't help but feel a little underwhelmed with it - as an obsessive player of Gunhound, Valken and similar mech shooters I think I overhyped myself a bit. I looked forward to its western - and later PC release for months and even double-dipped and bought the PS4 version anyway. Overall it's fine, maybe [i]average[/i] sums up the game better.

General gameplay is good, and achieves some pretty solid highs at times but suffers from some slightly annoying decisions like pulling you out of the action constantly to introduce a miniboss, or literally moving you away from a defense objective to fight an enemy only to throw a mission failed screen in your face when the thing you were initially defending ends up being destroyed by the enemy.

NPC and ship crew chatter is great (Japanese language subtitled), and the re-recorded music is well done.

Adding danmaku bullet patterns to bosses and minibosses was unnecessary.

Classic Mode - an extra version based on the original Mega Drive game is an often frustrating mess of never-ending swarming enemies that gets so OTT at times you can not see yourself and only really resembles the original game in its BGM and basic mission structure.

The menus are a bit of a mess, for example the customization option to put a targeting sight on your rifle is buried in the game options.

Trophies and achievements are bugged and won't pop sometimes (PS4 and PC).

Visually it resembles a flash game; some of the elements look OK, others look cheap and unfinished - even the PS2 Valken remake looks nicer.

Not a bad game by any means, but disappointing and overpriced. Get it on sale if at all, the Arcade Mode is what you're going to be spending most of your time with, thankfully it's the best part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006950912', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1528046170}
review:
想怀旧好久结果到最近才查清楚这游戏的名字，一看还有重制版，STEAM销售的版本为主机移植，按键提示均对应手柄，好在操作不算复杂，瞎摸能把所有功能键按出来。

游戏还是有点剧情的，地球突然受到外来宇宙舰队的攻击，被打入在地球上建立了前线基地，与此同时这个宇宙舰队还一气攻击其他星球的地球人驻地，玩家控制的主角是一名驾驶量产机雷诺斯的普通士兵，驻守在木卫基地上，和同伴死守过一轮攻击后跟随部队撤离木卫一路杀回地球参加反攻，在这期间意外发现了这起入侵的来龙去脉。虽说是驾驶量产机的普通士兵，但按照主角这表现和战绩已经是妥妥的王牌啊，而且还有天天心系你平安的蓝毛妹子。

关卡流程情节基本上是90年初代的重现和调整，追加了部分大型敌人和BOSS，表现力和流畅度自然不同往日，但是除了前两关以外，同场景下却缺少了友军机体的点缀，以前原版里经常能看见相同型号的友军在同一个画面里出现，强调了战争的氛围而且提醒了你是量产杂鱼，重制后没了这个就变得像单人无双了，虽然说游戏本质上确实也是单人无双。

游戏流程不长，关卡不超过10关，三小时内应该都可以通了，难度上比原版多加入了一个简单难度，而普通难度个人感觉一上来也比原版普通难度稍低一些，但是依然非常有难度，而且后期敌人的弹幕可以说是变厚了，好在续关不像原版有次数限制，多死几次也不怕。
根据关卡目标选择对的武器能降低攻略难度，不过说白了就是无限弹的武器清杂鱼，节省好重火力武器打大型目标。

游戏音乐是原版音乐的翻新版，依旧动感耐听，而且人物对话加入了配音，中规中矩吧。
怀旧或者喜欢高难度横版射击游戏又喜欢机甲的玩家可以酌情入手。

author: {'steamid': '76561197990672230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1522925955}
review:
Okay look, full disclosure, I have never played a Target Earth/Assault Suits game in my life. This was my first foray. It's already made a great impression though. The storyline is rock solid, from what I've read up it's not been censored or altered from the original in any way so all the story is there and basically if you want a game that's very like MS Gundam (as in the original series, with Amuro Ray etc) with a largely hard tech feel and with a serious story that's rather more adult about war than you might expect, you really can't go far wrong with this.

Gameplay is pretty solid too, controls are good, concise, easy to understand. There's some....minor niggles in aiming and such, and whilst a lot of people criticise the pad controls I've had little to no issues with it on a Dualshock 4 used natively through steam. I suppose my main complaint about the controls that I can think of is that it's very like an old Megadrive game (Genesis for you americans out there that might or might not even read this review), so there's a lot of quality of life features lacking of course. All in all though, it feels, plays and looks pretty alright.

Honestly I do have some complaints about the pricing of the game, especially since in the time I've played it as of writing this review I got to what seems to be the final boss (who is kicking my arse with a seemingly unavoidable attack so, you know, business as usual with an old megadrive game ported to newer systems instead of actually updated in any meaningful way aside from graphics and sound e_e;). If memory serves it comes in normally at about £15 in English money. Getting this for £6 ish was a fair bit more reasonable in my books, but I will give the game credit in that its soundtrack is pretty great, the game looks and feels good, and I have few complaints in general. I'm glad I got it. It's good fun!

Give it a shot if you're also new to the series. Maybe check out some of the other games in the series too! (though obviously on other platforms. ^^; )

author: {'steamid': '76561197993825371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1522617823}
review:
Positiv finde ich die diversen Einstellungsmöglichkeiten des Spiels. Die Levels spielen sich teils auch unterschiedlich, es gibt z.B. ein Level im All und Levels auf der Oberfläche sowie in gegnerischen Basen. 
Man kann seinen Mech auch vor Missionsbeginn konfigurieren, ein Feature welches ich in Mechspielen liebe.
Soundtechnisch bin ich auch zufrieden wobei sicher noch mehr möglich gewesen wäre, Nun aber zum Negativpart: 

Die Steuerung dieses originären PS 4 Titels lässt etwas zu wünschen übrig auch wenn der Port dieses Spiels nicht so missraten ist wie der furchtbare Gundhound Port vom selben Entwickler.
Darüberhinaus muss ich leider nach 3 Stunden sagen, dass mir das Spiel einfach keinen Spaß macht. Die Levelbosse haben oft ähnliche Angriffsschema, was oft billig wirkt da sich diese Schema sehr oft wiederholen. Auf Normal sind die meisten Bosse recht einfach, sind sie schwer dann oft nur weil sie viele  HP haben.
Die Grafik ist auch nicht der Knaller, irgendwie wirkt das Design nicht stimmig teils auch veraltet. 
Um ehrlich zu sein mir hat das Original Target Earth schon nicht gefallen, dasselbe gilt nun leider für das Remake. 
Da zogg ich lieber wieder den Nachfolger Cybernator der damals fürs Super Nintendo kam und mir heute noch ähnlich viel Spaß macht wie im letzten Jahrtausend (trotz zu langer Dialogsequenzen aber hey das ist ja bei diesem Remake leider auch wieder der Fall...).

author: {'steamid': '76561198068199333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1600015960}
review:
Je joue à Leynos au pad Xbox360, c vrai que le jeu a un peu de mal à le calibrer. En insistant et en mappant le "padset", on arrive à faire fonctionner la manette et le stick analogique gauche. Les sensations de jeu sont excellentes, par rapport à la version 16 bits megadrive le jeu en met plein la vue - objectivement on est plutôt sur du style dreamcast/ps2 lissé HD donc pas de la technique dernier cri, mais le design a un charme fou et une forte ambiance Robotech (les composantes Macross et Mospeada de la série).
Déferlement d'action, jeu pas vraiment  facile mais hyper maniable, il faut gérer impérativement la remontée automatique de la barre de vie entre deux déferlantes de balles. Gros plus :le jeu - l'original comme ce remake - a un scénario de guerre spatiale à la japonaise et les niveaux s'enchainent logiquement selon cette trame, sans que le joueur soit "promené" d'un lieu à l' autre  sans lien logique. L'habillage manga - en VO- des transmissions en début de niveau parachève l'impression d'être un Valkyrie/Varitech en communication avec le SDF1.
Je recommande vivement; même s'il s'agit d'un Run&Gun à la Metal Slug ou Contra, le fait de diriger un Mecha et non un humain  rend le gameplay assez unique de par son inertie bien simulée, seuls les joueurs des différents Assault Suilt(s ) sur SNES, Saturn et PS2 ont pû ressentir ce feeling.

review:
ゲーム性以前の問題で買うべきではない一本。

①ゲームパッドの異常動作。
　こうなる条件は定かではないですが、ジョイパッドの十字キーを押すとゲームリセットされる謎仕様で、
　キーコンフィグもできない。キーコンフィグ画面で十字キーを押してもリセットされてしまいますのでｗｗｗ
②キーボード入力の雑さ。
　ＥＳＣ押すと確認画面も無くゲームが一発で落ちる。初期での決定/キャンセルがＺ，Ｘに設定されており、その旨表記も無い。
・・・まあここまではプレイヤーの努力でなんとかなりますが・・
③画面のフラッシュ、明滅が酷すぎる
　ポ〇モンですか。。
　最新技術を使用して爆発時に画面が激しくフラッシュ、点滅して目の負担が半端ないです。
テストプレイ時に問題にならなかったのでしょうか？見た目の派手さを狙ったのでしょうが、こんな輝度の変化が酷いゲームは珍しいです。
移植できているか以前の問題で、ほんとにこれを作った人はモノ作りの一番大事な部分を理解していないんだなあ・・と感じます。

買う前にＹＯＵＴＵＢＥやデモムービーをフルスクリーンで見て、明滅にあなたの目が耐えられるかか確認の上
購入の判断をすることをオススメします！！

review:
アーケードモードクリア時点での感想

アップデートの痕跡がなかったので自分も恐らく同じ環境なので言うが、そんなに箱コン絡みでグチグチ言うなら別のUSBパッド使えよ…
ちなみに当方箱360コンでも使用可でした、変換コネクタ経由でPS2コン使ってたけど

まぁモノがもう25年前（PS4版が2015年リリース）のシロモノなのでアレンジ自体は理解できるし、
兄弟作の重装機兵ヴァルケンを操作系のベースにするのも理解できる、ただ挙動の重量感は足りないと思うが
なのでプレイ感もゲームデザインも原作から激変してる、メガドライブ版と同じものを期待すると間違いなく痛い目を見るだろコレ
オマケでクラシックモードじゃなくてメガドライブ版自体を移植してればよかったと思う、そもそもクラシックモードがあんまりクラシックしてないし

ゲームシステム的にベースになってるヴァルケンの系譜のゲームとして考えればまぁ悪くない
ゲームバランスもそんなにおかしくないし、操作感も爽快感も悪くない、楽曲も良いしでそれなりに纏まってる印象
まぁ所々ヴァルケンのオマージュが入ったのは気になったが…ドラキューってヴァルケン本当好きなんだろうなあ
ただコレ作ってんのはレイノスだよ？ここはもう少し分別してほしいと思った
あと個人的にゾウザリー生存ルートあるなら隊長生存ルートも欲しかったか

まぁ、90年台の2Dロボットアクション遊びたいなと思うならちょうどいいゲームだと思う

なお、これはウインターセールで安価に買ったからの感想
PS4版発売時のフルプライスだと流石に「ええ…」となると思う

author: {'steamid': '76561198033632960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1480753298}
review:
В условиях того, что игры Гандам, Макросс и Вотомс "не поставляются" на персональные компьютеры (исключения есть, но так-то речь идет об играх на приставки, и то часто только на японском языке), Armored Suit Leynos - это настоящее спасение. Особенно если вы смотрите немеренно меха-аниме и уже некуда девать энергию, захваченную на вдохновении (хочется самому "посидеть за манипуляторами").
Ведь действительно - дизайн мобильного доспеха можно назвать детализированным, есть история, есть живая эмоциональная озвучка, есть трепещущий фон, как будто ты летишь в окружении десятков и сотен союзников, есть трагедия героев, разные локации, есть и ситуация, что роботизированный доспех не в состоянии утащить все прекрасное оружие, приходится выбирать, без робобоссов не обойдется (умм, сразу вспыхнуь аналогии с мобильной броней, с роботами, которые раз в 80 больше самого меха-доспеха персонажа). У меня складывалось в наушниках ощущение, что я вообще в аниме. Я не додумываю, я реально говорю впечатление из игры.

Всё, что я написал, принципиально. Даже в Steam игр с роботами хватает. Но вот сочетание всего вышесказанного - это редкость (ближе всего Vulkaiser). Обычно игры с роботами напоминают набивалку очков или просто тоскуешь по сюжету.

Рекомендую. Для одного прохода игра прекрасна. Можно понаставить себе задач и пройти игру с определенными типами пушек, ракетниц, иных орудий.

review:
I don't like to make serious reviews but this game is ayuss.

The third stage literally has you standing in one place mashing the punch button as an endless conga line of 1 enemy type runs straight into your fist and dies. 

Then, after a certain amount of tedium, the game teleports you to the center of the level to fight a boss without killing off any of the remaining conga line. This means that if you weren't past the middle of the stage, all of the conga line runs straight into the base you were trying to defend and gives you an instant game over while you're trying to have a cool 1v1 mech fight. 

And if you were past the middle of the stage, the conga line runs straight into your 1v1, killing the mood.

This is only one example of the serious lack of polish this game has. 

Not worth $20, not even worth $10 for how buggy and borked this game is. Do yourself a favor and buy Gunhound or play Cybernator on an emulator instead of wasting time on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106590527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1493660073}
review:
先ず重要な事から述べますが、Xbox-Oneのパッドでも、現時点ではちゃんとトリガーボタンが使えるようになっています。
しかし、問題なのは「設定変更前ではパッドが使えず、キーボードのXで決定、Zでキャンセル、選択項目の上下もカーソルキーでしかできない」事で、初回起動時に「デモ画面でキーボードのXを押し、表示されたメニューからコントロールのパッドを選択しなければならない」のに、その肝心な事が一切記載されていません。
この手順を踏まないと、いつまでたってもパッドでのコントロールができず、当然ゲームを遊べない訳ですから、ユーザーへの配慮に欠けると言わざるを得ません。

次に、ゲームの内容に関してですが、本来なかったはずのダッシュが追加された為か、難易度ノーマルのStage1から既に敵の数が多く、行動パターンも変更されており、徒歩では敵をまったく引き離せないので、DDのみを装備して裏技を…が出来なくなっています。(ダッシュで引き離せ、という事なのでしょうが…)
クラッシックモードとやらは何の為…そもそもパンチも構えるタイプのシールドも要らないのに…これでは劣化したヴァルケンもどきとしか言えません。
嘗て発売されたレイノス2が、何故ゲームのアクション性一つですら大半のユーザーから駄目出しを喰ったのか…ここの開発さん達は別段レイノスが好きだったという訳ではなさそうなので、その事にも何ら関心を持てなかったのでしょうね。
せめてクラッシックモードくらいは本来の仕様に戻しておいて欲しかったです。
(それにしても、HG-Gunがないって本当でしょうか…確認したかったのですが、クラシックモードの酷さに驚き、やる気が激減したのでまだ検証できていません。
尚、レイノス2に関してですが、私個人は「レイノスで既に完結しているものを、外伝的な位置付けで発売した別物」と認識している為、ヴァルケン共々レイノスのシリーズ作品などとは考えておりません)

さて、今更ながらに購入し、レビューを書いたものの、最初に述べた「重要な事」が全てなので、他の方々の補足というよりは追記と蛇足程度に思っていただければ良いと思います。
私のように「怖いモノ見たさ」でセール時に購入する以外は、基本的に無視した方が良いゲームだと断言できますが、興味を抱いて購入を考えていた方々の中には、操作の部分で見送った方も居られるかと感じましたので、ご参考までに。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025413056', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1558925534}
review:
This is a remake of the Sega Genesis classic "Target Earth" that was hard as balls and rad as fuck.
While it's a lot less difficult, and the sometimes sketchy translation blunts the coolness, I still greatly enjoyed playing and 100%ing it!

It's a difficult title to recommend at its current pricepoint, mostly because of its fairly arcade-game length. It suffers problems in respects to bugs (a lot of having to do things over with achievements), and I have a number of nit-picks about how the scripted sequences were changed, even in the more faithful "classic mode".

That said however, this remake is a dream come true for me, and is extremely impressive to have been made in the first place. All the right decisions were made in what to keep and what to update. Everything that was censored in the original's western release regarding some slightly romantic dialogue and anti-war themes were fully restored - which is fantastic.

The end result is a game with a lot of problems, but a lot of fun to play.

review:
是抱著懷念 MD 版的心情買來玩的，大體來說是一個不錯的重製版，也算是耐玩。

劇情和台詞的重製令人覺得扼腕，

有愛的人就買吧，但是等特賣還是一個比較好的選擇。

author: {'steamid': '76561198015033042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1586852594}
review:
Assault Suit Leynos was a cult classic on the Sega Genesis released in North America as Target Earth, and this HD remake serves as the ultimate way to experience it. For the uninitiated, Assault Suits is a small short lived mecha franchise from the 90s that wears its classic mecha anime influences on its sleeve without any shame at all, and are known for being intense and difficult with deliberately slow and heavy controls meant to really feel like you're controlling a massive metal war machine.

The remake brings the original Sega game into the modern age with some GORGEOUS 2D graphics that are extremely detailed and pleasing to look at. The original game's beloved soundtrack is completely redone with rocking music, sound effects have that retro sound and vibe to them, its just a fantastic game to look and listen to. Gameplay is improved from the original, taking in some carry over ideas from Assault Suits Valken from the SNES - namely the expanded control scheme giving the shield and boost dedicated buttons as well as a melee attack. There are eight levels of progressing difficulty, often with narrative driven objectives such as destroying enemy warships or protecting valuable targets as opposed to just reaching the end of a level. There's an arcade and classic mode, with classic being based off the original Sega game with no voice acting or extra features, and arcade mode offers slightly retooled levels with extra objectives and expanded story with voice acting.

The game is hard as hell, the original was known for its legendary difficulty and the remake retains that spirit with gusto. There are no lives and infinite continues at least, but that's just a small comfort for how much certain levels and bosses will beat you in. If you're into that retro-hard challegne that comes from repetition, memorization, and raw "git gud", then you'll find Leynos welcome, but it isn't for everyone. The game also essentially NEEDS a gamepad to be enjoyed, this is a port of a PS4 game, and while it supports keyboard that is not how the original or the remake was intended to be played. Be forewarned!

There are some technical issues, though. The game has some unfairly demanding system requirements (mostly due to each level loading all its assets at once which is STUPID), and even with a modest machine you can get some slowdown. Fortunately this slowdown is in the SNES style where too many sprites on the screen cause everything to move in slow motion as opposed to frame rate skips and choppiness, so its perfectly playable regardless, but beware momements where too much is exploding on screen at once.

All in all though if you're a fan of retro games or a fan of mecha games then Leynos is one of the best either way. The remake truly gave it love an adoration, the developers being obvious fans who made their own mecha action game called Armored Suit Gunhound EX, which if you've played can see the clear and obvious influences from Assault Suits on. Definite recommendation from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968994186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1574593720}
review:
Cannot recommend it as a PC game.
While the art is okay even with some updated assets the style is very much showing it's age.
Controls are not customize-able & are hard coded to a very awkward scheme. With out mouse aiming it still plays very much like trying to run a Playstation game on PC... things are just messy. The menu to quit the game is a VERY un-intuative P button... well away from any other controls & the game does not respond to the enter key... even when it says "push button". (It's left to the player to figure out which button.)
Resolution control is handled poorly with the escape key changing the game to a windowed mode instead of bringing up a menu like most games would & pressing it a second time exits the game with out warning instead of reversing your last action like expected.
Controls are presented with an Xbox game pad in the controls screen showing little effort to port it to PC; it's very obvious they want Xbox to be their main market along with all the other PC unfriendly things.
Game runs smoothly but is a rather large size at 4.82 GB. There appears to be no way to gracefully quit the game being forced to use alt-f4 when in game.
Over all the game shows its age, is very much over priced for what you get & you'd be better off finding & purchasing any of the older american releases of this series; you'd be getting about the same product for a much more reasonable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991963037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1482714931}
review:
What this game looks like it should be based on the videos and screenshots would be pretty cool, unfortunately the controls, menus, and general game design does not live up to it.
-You get to customize your loadout every story mission, but in the first mission you don't have anything to switch out so it's just a waste of time as you try and re-try as the difficulty is ridiculous. This also adds frustration as you can't just hit a "confirm" button to continue, you have to scroll down to a "start" button and then confirm. Also, the stuff you unlock isn't available when you choose to play individual missions instead of a continuous story mode.
-Most of the difficulty comes from massive enemy groups that seem to be continuously respawning alongside time-limited special enemies who sometimes get a cinematic entrance and boss health bar, but mostly don't, plus the poor control scheme.
-Since this game is a remake of an older title its controls only account for one d-pad/control stick. As a result you have to aim and move with the same directional control. This is a big problem because, as mentioned above, there are huge groups of enemies advancing toward you so you will spend most of your time retreating, meaning you have to keep turning around in between bursts of fire, also your block only protects from attacks hitting your front side. There is an aim-lock button, but if your aim is slightly too high or low you have to stop, reorient, fire to make sure you're lined up, lock, and then continue moving, this method is arguably just as bad. This is frustrating on land missions, but in zero-gravity missions it is even worse as you need to keep dodging enemy fire by flying up and down.
-As mentioned above, unlocks seem to be either broken or highly specific. There is an overall levelling system which has told me that I unlocked weapons for customization, but I didn't see them anywhere. It turns out that after you unlock things you have to go into your options menu and switch them on for some reason. Also many of the unlocks seem to be a way of padding out basic content. In the little time I played I unlocked both a laser sight to show me where my shots would go and a meter informing me how much boost I have left. Those weren't special equipable tools or anything, they were universally "switched on" from that point on.
-Overall this game just reeks of incompletion. Basic enemy density and weapon power need serious tweeking, Character protraits look and animate like something from early 2000's Newgrounds flashes, and after finishing the tutorial I found my character jumping up out of the bottom of the screen during an ingame text sequence, apparently they forgot to disconnect my inputs from my character so as I confirmed the completion of a text sequence, my mech would jump. Oh also, after rebinding the controls and coming back to the game later I found that somehow up and down had been bound to "reset". I had to delete and reinstall the whole game as there was no way to move through menus to change this. Also the most recent update at the current time is a developer update informing game owners that you can't exit the game using a controller, you need to press esc on your keyboard.

Just don't buy it unless a there is a major update/mod some time in the future

author: {'steamid': '76561197996217035', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1480827029}
review:
A remake of Sega Mega Drive classic Assault Suit Leynos (Target Earth on the US Genesis), the first game in the underrated Assault Suits series best known for Assault Suits Valken (censored and released as Cybernator in the US). With both a fun, if a little easy, main arcade mode that re-imagines the game and adds references to Valken and a more hardcore classic mode that plays closer to the original game.

The 2D anime graphics are fantastic and there's something here for both casual and hardcore side-scrolling action fans. For fans of the Assault Suits series this is a no brainer and you've probably already bought it. Veterans will be better off playing the arcade mode on the hardest difficulty or sticking to the classic mode.

Dracue already showed love for this franchise with their own Gunhound EX and this game is an obvious labor of love. There's lots of stuff to unlock so there's definate replay value even with the game's short length though people who aren't already fans might be better off picking it up at a lower price though I personally feel there's $15 worth of enjoyment here for mecha action fans.

review:
Target Earth, Cybernator, and many other games from my childhood all come from the Assault suit Leynos franchise, and they helped shape my Mecha/anime fanaticism. 

Imagine my joy when I discovered that a PC remake was released in August!  A Faithful recreation of Target earth with some nifty changes, amazing graphics and familiar gameplay?  SIGN. ME. UP!

So I plunk down my 20$ because most reviews are pretty positive, and saddle up to beat the game in 2 hours or less. 

I turn on the game... it starts in some windowed mode, meh, no big deal I'll change it in the options menu... I press start on my Xbone controller, and nothing happens.  A?  B?  Back?  Bumpers, triggers?  Nothing. 

I thumb the left stick and the game restarts.... I do it again and sure enough it just reboots... 

I try the keyboard... nada... Oh wait, Z, X?

WTF?

I get to the options, set it to xbox. 

Restart. 

Same difference, no dice, my controller doesn't work. 

Ok, well Let me try it with keyboard...  Ludacris controls make the game unplayable. 

Anyway... I would love to reccomend this game, but I should have gotten it on PS4 I guess, so I could use a controller... 

BAD port, and this issue should be fixed already, I SAW the Devs adress this, but it's still not fixed.  The game has been out for 2 months, IMHO such a key issue should have been fixed already.  I suppose it may never be fixed now.  I'll have to look up some possible fixes, but until or unless the devs update with a fix, this game isn't getting a thumbs up.

In fact, I'm taking a REFUND ASAP.

review:
Assault Suit Leynos (Target Earth) (重装機兵レイノス Jūsō Kihei Reinosu) 
Este es un remake del mismo titulo que salio para Sega Genesis - Mega Drive en 1990, en su momento lo jugue en la consola física, es un juego muy dificil aun asi solo lo termine en dificultad normal.
Este remake sigue el mismo argumento, incluye muchos conceptos del original y añade otros como de Cybernator (Assault Suits Valken) (重装機兵ヴァルケン Jūsō Kihei Varuken) de 1992 y Assault Suit Leynos II de 1997.
En general es muy divertido, regresa esa nostalgia por la historia y hacen mas entendible el argumento del juego.

review:
レイノスと聞いて早速プレイしてみました。
結論から申し上げますとコレジャナイレイノスです。
オススメするのはロボゲー好きな方で原作が好きな方にはオススメしません。
パッドでのプレイを推奨します。

自機周り
・出撃前に武装をカスタマイズ可能
・武装は切り替えボタンでの使い分け
・射撃の他にパンチする事が可能
・ジャンプ、ブーストの回避行動
・前方からの殆どの攻撃を防げるシールド

良いところ
・敵の種類の追加

良くないところ
・無駄に硬くなってしまった敵
・母艦への着艦のし辛さ
・点滅多様によるエフェクトのうざったさ
・派手な爆発エフェクトと煙が引き起こす自機や敵弾の見辛さ
・波エフェクトの手抜き加減
・殺気が無くなった適当なライバル機と旧ラスボス
・繋がりの一切無いぽっと出の新ラスボス
・新ラスボスのつまらない最低な攻撃
・いまいちな顔絵と音声

なんだかリメイクというよりレイノスのストーリーをベースに
ヴァルケン以降のシステムで作ってみたような内容でした。
しかも敵が硬いので原作よりテンポが悪くなった気がします。
映像も綺麗ですが点滅多用し過ぎてて安っぽいです。
多関節キャラを高解像度にするとﾌﾗｯｼｭ動画のような
安っぽさが出てくるのは作り手の問題でしょうか．．．

開発はヴァルケンが好きならヴァルケンをリメイクしたら良かったのにと思いました。
この調子だと原作越えは無理でしょうが。

review:
If you loved the Genesis/Mega Drive game you'll love this!

For those not in the know, Assault Suit Leynos here is a remake of a classic side-scrolling mecha action game for the Sega Mega Drive, known in the US on the Genesis as "Target Earth."

There's some really great content here.  Not only do you get a newly remastered "Arcade Mode" with voice acted dialogue, expanded missions, and brand-new bosses, but the game also includes a "Classic Mode" that keeps things remarkably faithful to the original version of the game (even going so far as to change the music and firing sound effects to the original Mega Drive versions).

The controls here are super solid.  While the game can be played with a keyboard though, I'd highly recommend using a gamepad instead.  And don't forget to lock your firing angle (left shoulder button on a 360 controller) when you need to focus your aim on a particular target!

As you gain points in missions, you'll unlock new features to mess around with, like a laser sight for your primary weapon, a visible boost gauge, and more.  You'll also unlock all of the story mode weapons to use in Stage Select, allowing you to replay missions you've beaten with any loadout you'd like.

Topping things off are (sadly untranslated) scans of concept art, development material, and the original Japanese Mega Drive instruction manual all found in-game, as well as a BGM player.  A nice little bonus for sure!

This is not a long game.  Arcade and Classic Mode can easily be beaten within an hour each, but if you're a fan of the original game or classic mecha action games in general, you owe it to yourself to pick this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006653128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1472668796}
review:
Assault Suit Leynos is a mecha platformer, similar to Assault Suits Valken (a.k.a. Cybernator for the SNES). It is designed as an arcade game that can be finished in two hours casually, or much faster if you practice speedrunning it.

The story is a pretty basic Gundam (Universal Century 0078) derivative, so its main strength is in the gameplay. Standard mode on easy difficulty is very casual-friendly, with regenerating health and plenty of opportunities to tradeoff weapon variety for more health. You get weapon and equipment unlocks in each mission depending on how well you do, and whether or not you fulfill certain secret conditions. Before each mission, you choose eight pieces of equipment, which can also include taking multiples of a special weapon or multiple layers of armor. You can even remove your standard gun (leaving a punch as your only ammo-less weapon), shield, and booster backpack if you really want to challenge yourself.

There is a classic mode with a much higher difficulty, and you can also turn up the difficulty higher if you really want. Anyone who wants to prove that they have the biggest e-p should do a no-equipment run in classic mode on hard difficulty.

If you can't get enough of games like Assault Suits Valken (Cybernator for the SNES), Armored Hunter GUNHOUND, and the like, then you should definitely buy this one.

overall if they can fix these bugs i would give it a 9/10
